titleStmt.title: The fiue bookes of the famous, learned, and eloquent man, Hieronimus Osorius, contayninge a discourse of ciuill, and Christian nobilitie A worke no lesse pleasaunt then profitable for all, but especiallye the noble gentlemen of England, to vievv their liues, their estates, and conditions in. Translated out of Latine into Englishe by VVilliam Blandie late of the Vniuersitie of Oxeford, and novv fellovv of the middle Temple in London.
De nobilitate civili et christiana. English
titleStmt.author: Osório, Jerónimo, 1506-1580.
Blandie, William.

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Osório, Jerónimo. De nobilitate civili et christiana.
At foot of title: Cum priuilegio.
The first leaf is blank except for two lines of ornaments and signature-mark "A1.".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
